attributes.action: Parliament debate the information contained in the Great Barrington Declaration.
attributes.additional_details: The government should not be acting solely on the advice of Prof. Chris Whitty, Patrick Vallance and SAGE.  I believe it is wrong to dismiss the Declaration when the government should be listening to other scientific advice which is often contrary to the advice of Professor Chris Whitty which has not achieved the desired outcome.
attributes.background: The authors of the Declaration are emiment scientists and are supported to date by over 25000 fellow scientists and medical practitioners and over 280000 of the general public.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552023

If this petition receives over 100,000 signatures it will be considered by the Petitions Committee for debate in the House of Commons.
